Replace.Text: The battleship Friedrich der Grosse of the Iron-Blooded Navy, one of the products of Plan H. My child, if you have trouble sleeping, let me sing you a lullaby.
Let’s quickly draw the curtain on today, the performers are already impatient!
Ulrich von Hutten, the hopes and regrets of Iron Blood. As for whether you are happy about my arrival or indifferent, it doesn't matter what you think. Of course, so do I
Trust is a deadly poison. Once you are addicted to it, the end result will be bleeding from all the orifices.

Units will not suffer combat strength debuffs after being injured, and gain +2 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for every 10 health points lost. [NEWLINE]The base output of all buildings (including wonders) is doubled, and when a level 2/3 building is completed, 1/2 random [ICON_TECHBOOSTED] Eureka and [ICON_CIVICBOOSTED] Inspiration will be provided.

Forced to alternate between the [ICON_GLORY_DARK_AGE] Dark and [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages from the Classical Age. [NEWLINE]Each era score gained provides [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity to all cities, [ICON_SCIENCE] technology value and [ICON_CULTURE] culture value to you. [NEWLINE] In [ICON_GLORY_DARK_AGE] Dark Ages: City [ICON_PRODUCTION] +50% Productivity, +1 Buildable Area; in [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age: Units +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement, +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat (These add The performance is affected by the accumulated time points of the previous era).

Unable to recruit [ICON_GREATPROPHET] Great Prophet and unable to build the Holy Land area. [NEWLINE]When a region is built for the first time, a corresponding policy slot is permanently unlocked:[NEWLINE]Port or commercial center: economic policy[NEWLINE]Industrial area or military camp: military policy[NEWLINE]Municipal square or diplomatic district: foreign policy[NEWLINE] College or Theater Square: Wildcard

A characteristic area of ​​the Iron Blood Principality, an alternative to the industrial zone. Unlocked in "Ironmaking" and has a lower construction cost. Base has +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity adjacency bonus. Provides [ICON_SCIENCE] technology value equal to the [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity adjacency bonus. When this area and its buildings are completed, a heavy cavalry unit that does not consume strategic resources to maintain is given as a gift.

The characteristic heavy cavalry unit of the Iron Blood Principality replaces tanks and has stronger mobility and combat effectiveness. +15 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength when defending against ranged attacks. +15 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength against area combat.
Does not consume strategic resources for maintenance
Placeholder policy card for filling slots only
I like civilizations that are still developing and prospering in the dark ages.
A civilization that likes to vigorously develop technology and culture while abandoning faith.
